title: 109_s673
content: The Act may be cited as the "Governmental Pension Plan Equalization Act of 2005". The definition of "governmental plan" is provided in the Act. The "Governmental Pension Plan Equalization Act of 2005" amends the Internal Revenue Code and the Employee Retirement Income Security Act to include plans established for employees by Indian tribal governments, subdivisions, agencies, or entities wholly owned or controlled by them. The "Governmental Pension Plan Equalization Act of 2005" includes plans established for employees by Indian tribal governments, subdivisions, agencies, or entities wholly owned or controlled by them. This encompasses entities established under Federal, State, or tribal law. SEC. 3. Extension of current moratorium on nondiscrimination rules to all governmental plans. The text discusses amendments to sections of the Internal Revenue Code related to governmental plans, specifically regarding the removal of certain language and headings. Amendments are made to sections of the Internal Revenue Code related to governmental plans, specifically regarding the removal and insertion of language and headings. Amendments are made to sections of the Internal Revenue Code related to governmental plans, specifically regarding the clarification that tribal governments are subject to the same defined benefit plan rules and regulations applied to state and other local governments, their police and firefighters. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 clarify that tribal governments are included in the defined benefit plan rules applicable to state and local governments, including police and firefighters. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include tribal governments in the defined benefit plan rules for state and local governments. The amendments specify the inclusion of Indian tribal governments and make conforming changes to the code. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include Indian tribal governments in the defined benefit plan rules for state and local governments. This change aligns with the amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, specifying the inclusion of Indian tribal governments in employee benefit plans. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include Indian tribal governments in the defined benefit plan rules for state and local governments, as specified in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This extends coverage to agencies, instrumentalities, and entities owned or controlled by Indian tribal governments. The amendments made by this Act apply to any year before, on, or after the enactment date.
